name: Shlomo Fishman
texto:
I'm getting pretty tired of international organizations, such as the UN, its' sub-organizations, the ICRC and others, keep telling us that "even war has rules", regarding the Israeli operation in Gaza. 

Somehow, it seems they have never read their own rules. Contrary to the general slogans they usually add to their posts, here are some actual paragraphs of that international law (the Geneva Convention, 1949) you should know about:

🔸 Article 19 - The protection to which civilian hospitals are entitled shall not cease unless they are used to commit, outside their humanitarian duties, acts harmful to the enemy. Protection may, however, cease only after due warning has been given, naming, in all appropriate cases, a reasonable time limit, and after such warning has remained unheeded.

So far, all of the 36 hospitals in Gaza are still standing despite the Hamas tunnel entrances, weapons, surrendered armed terrorists, discovered in some of them. Hamas' rockets hitting the Israeli Barzilai hospital haven't been condemned yet. 

🔸Article 3 -  To this end, the following acts are and shall remain prohibited at any time and in any place whatsoever with respect to the above-mentioned persons:

(a) Violence to life and person, in particular murder of all kinds, mutilation, cruel treatment and torture;

(b) Taking of hostages;

(c) Outrages upon personal dignity, in particular humiliating and degrading treatment;

(d) The passing of sentences and the carrying out of executions without previous judgment pronounced by a regularly constituted court, affording all the judicial guarantees which are recognized as indispensable by civilized peoples.

This paragraph is an exact description of the Hamas massacre on Oct. 7th, but no condemnation of Hamas regarding this article, wasn't published yet. 

🔸Article 4 - ..Nationals of a State which is not bound by the Convention are not protected by it.
 
The heavy anti-Israeli bias of those prominent international organizations, has created an absurd situation which completely contradicts the statement of article 4: Hamas has never adopted the Geneva Convention, Israel did. Despite that, Hamas and their population are de facto entirely protected by it, while Israel isn't, simply because those organizations decided who they support and who they are against.

Hopefully something will change about that, but seeing how the UN, the ICRC, the WHO and others officially stopped hiding their bias, I'm not optimistic about it at all.

name: ONU Info
texto:
Le chef de @WHO Dr Tedros déplore les frappes contre l'hôpital Al-Amal géré par @PalestineRCS dans la ville de Khan Younis, dans le sud de #Gaza. Les attaques auraient tué au moins cinq civils

"Je me joins aux appels internationaux en faveur d'un cessez-le-feu immédiat"
texto_tweet_citado:
I deplore today’s strikes on the @PalestineRCS-run Al-Amal hospital in the southern #Gaza city of Khan Younis, which severely damaged the Palestine Red Crescent Society training centre located within the hospital complex.

My @WHO and @UNOCHA colleagues today undertook a mission to the facilities, where they witnessed extensive damage and displacement of civilians

The attacks, according to the PRCS, killed at least five civilians, including a 5-day old infant. 14,000 people were sheltering at the hospital in the besieged southern #Gaza city of Khan Younis. Many of them have now left, and those remaining are extremely fearful for their safety and planning to leave a place they had turned to for refuge and protection.

Hospitals, ambulances, health workers, and people seeking care must be protected, at all times, under international humanitarian law. Today’s bombardments are unconscionable. Gaza’s health system is already on its knees, with health and aid workers continuously stymied in their efforts to save lives due to the hostilities.
 
I join international calls for an immediate ceasefire, including urgent action to ensure the accelerated and unimpeded flow of food, medical supplies, water and other essential items to millions of civilians forced to live in unspeakable conditions of hunger, disease spread, and lack of hygiene and sanitation. Gazans are still receiving only a fraction of the supplies they had access to before the war, just as only a fraction of Gazans in need of medical evacuation are being evacuated. This is unacceptable in light of the dire humanitarian catastrophe which has unfolded over three months.
 
Indeed, WHO’s movements, particularly in northern Gaza and increasingly in the south, have been severely impeded by the ongoing violence inside Gaza. Our operations are further impeded when essential local partners, like the @PalestineRCS, are themselves needlessly impacted by the strikes.
 
This on top of widespread deaths, suffering and decimation of homes, roads and other infrastructure across this tiny coastal strip of land. If the conditions for a cease-fire in hostilities have not been met by now, I do not know what it will take.

WHO reiterates that health must never be a target during conflicts, and all effort must be taken to protect health facilities, health workers, and patients.

texto_tweet_citado:
I deplore today’s strikes on the @PalestineRCS-run Al-Amal hospital in the southern #Gaza city of Khan Younis, which severely damaged the Palestine Red Crescent Society training centre located within the hospital complex.

My @WHO and @UNOCHA colleagues today undertook a mission to the facilities, where they witnessed extensive damage and displacement of civilians

The attacks, according to the PRCS, killed at least five civilians, including a 5-day old infant. 14,000 people were sheltering at the hospital in the besieged southern #Gaza city of Khan Younis. Many of them have now left, and those remaining are extremely fearful for their safety and planning to leave a place they had turned to for refuge and protection.

Hospitals, ambulances, health workers, and people seeking care must be protected, at all times, under international humanitarian law. Today’s bombardments are unconscionable. Gaza’s health system is already on its knees, with health and aid workers continuously stymied in their efforts to save lives due to the hostilities.
 
I join international calls for an immediate ceasefire, including urgent action to ensure the accelerated and unimpeded flow of food, medical supplies, water and other essential items to millions of civilians forced to live in unspeakable conditions of hunger, disease spread, and lack of hygiene and sanitation. Gazans are still receiving only a fraction of the supplies they had access to before the war, just as only a fraction of Gazans in need of medical evacuation are being evacuated. This is unacceptable in light of the dire humanitarian catastrophe which has unfolded over three months.
 
Indeed, WHO’s movements, particularly in northern Gaza and increasingly in the south, have been severely impeded by the ongoing violence inside Gaza. Our operations are further impeded when essential local partners, like the @PalestineRCS, are themselves needlessly impacted by the strikes.
 
This on top of widespread deaths, suffering and decimation of homes, roads and other infrastructure across this tiny coastal strip of land. If the conditions for a cease-fire in hostilities have not been met by now, I do not know what it will take.

WHO reiterates that health must never be a target during conflicts, and all effort must be taken to protect health facilities, health workers, and patients.

texto_tweet_citado:
I deplore today’s strikes on the @PalestineRCS-run Al-Amal hospital in the southern #Gaza city of Khan Younis, which severely damaged the Palestine Red Crescent Society training centre located within the hospital complex.

My @WHO and @UNOCHA colleagues today undertook a mission to the facilities, where they witnessed extensive damage and displacement of civilians

The attacks, according to the PRCS, killed at least five civilians, including a 5-day old infant. 14,000 people were sheltering at the hospital in the besieged southern #Gaza city of Khan Younis. Many of them have now left, and those remaining are extremely fearful for their safety and planning to leave a place they had turned to for refuge and protection.

Hospitals, ambulances, health workers, and people seeking care must be protected, at all times, under international humanitarian law. Today’s bombardments are unconscionable. Gaza’s health system is already on its knees, with health and aid workers continuously stymied in their efforts to save lives due to the hostilities.
 
I join international calls for an immediate ceasefire, including urgent action to ensure the accelerated and unimpeded flow of food, medical supplies, water and other essential items to millions of civilians forced to live in unspeakable conditions of hunger, disease spread, and lack of hygiene and sanitation. Gazans are still receiving only a fraction of the supplies they had access to before the war, just as only a fraction of Gazans in need of medical evacuation are being evacuated. This is unacceptable in light of the dire humanitarian catastrophe which has unfolded over three months.
 
Indeed, WHO’s movements, particularly in northern Gaza and increasingly in the south, have been severely impeded by the ongoing violence inside Gaza. Our operations are further impeded when essential local partners, like the @PalestineRCS, are themselves needlessly impacted by the strikes.
 
This on top of widespread deaths, suffering and decimation of homes, roads and other infrastructure across this tiny coastal strip of land. If the conditions for a cease-fire in hostilities have not been met by now, I do not know what it will take.

WHO reiterates that health must never be a target during conflicts, and all effort must be taken to protect health facilities, health workers, and patients.

name: オランジュ
texto:
私は、南部#Gaza都市カーンユニスにある@PalestineRCSが運営するアル・アマル病院に対する本日のストライキを遺憾に思います。このストライキにより、病院複合施設内にあるパレスチナ赤新月社の研修センターが甚大な被害を受けました。

私の同僚@WHOと@UNOCHAは今日、施設への任務を引き受け、そこで大規模な被害と民間人の避難を目撃しました。

PRCS によれば、この攻撃により生後 5 日の乳児を含む少なくとも 5 人の民間人が死亡した。包囲された南部#Gaza都市カーンユニスの病院には1万4000人が避難していた。彼らの多くは現在去っており、残っている人々は自分たちの安全を極度に恐れており、避難と保護のために頼っていた場所を離れる計画を立てています。

病院、救急車、医療従事者、ケアを求める人々は、国際人道法に基づいて常に保護されなければなりません。今日の砲撃は非良心的です。ガザの医療システムはすでに崩壊しており、医療従事者や援助従事者は敵対行為により命を救う取り組みが常に妨げられている。

私は即時停戦を求める国際的な呼びかけに参加します。これには、飢え、病気の蔓延、衛生状態の欠如という言葉では言い表せない状況での生活を余儀なくされている何百万もの民間人に、食料、医薬品、水、その他の必需品が加速して妨げられずに流れることを保証するための緊急行動が含まれます。そして衛生管理。医療避難を必要とするガザ人の一部だけが避難しているのと同様に、ガザ人は戦前に入手できた物資のほんの一部しかまだ受け取っていない。 3か月にわたって起こった悲惨な人道的惨事を考慮すると、これは容認できない。

実際、特にガザ北部、そしてますます南部でのWHOの活動は、ガザ内で進行中の暴力によって著しく妨げられている。 @PalestineRCSのような重要な現地パートナー自体がストライキによって不必要な影響を受けると、当社の業務はさらに妨げられます。

これに加えて、この小さな海岸沿いの土地全体で広範囲にわたる死、苦しみ、家屋、道路、その他のインフラの破壊が起こっています。敵対行為における停戦の条件がまだ整っていない場合、何が必要になるかはわかりません。

WHOは、紛争中は決して健康が標的になってはならず、医療施設、医療従事者、患者を守るためにあらゆる努力を払わなければならないと改めて強調する。
menciones: @PalestineRCSのような重要な現地パートナー自体がストライキによって不必要な影響を受けると

texto_tweet_citado:
I deplore today’s strikes on the @PalestineRCS-run Al-Amal hospital in the southern #Gaza city of Khan Younis, which severely damaged the Palestine Red Crescent Society training centre located within the hospital complex.

My @WHO and @UNOCHA colleagues today undertook a mission to the facilities, where they witnessed extensive damage and displacement of civilians

The attacks, according to the PRCS, killed at least five civilians, including a 5-day old infant. 14,000 people were sheltering at the hospital in the besieged southern #Gaza city of Khan Younis. Many of them have now left, and those remaining are extremely fearful for their safety and planning to leave a place they had turned to for refuge and protection.

Hospitals, ambulances, health workers, and people seeking care must be protected, at all times, under international humanitarian law. Today’s bombardments are unconscionable. Gaza’s health system is already on its knees, with health and aid workers continuously stymied in their efforts to save lives due to the hostilities.
 
I join international calls for an immediate ceasefire, including urgent action to ensure the accelerated and unimpeded flow of food, medical supplies, water and other essential items to millions of civilians forced to live in unspeakable conditions of hunger, disease spread, and lack of hygiene and sanitation. Gazans are still receiving only a fraction of the supplies they had access to before the war, just as only a fraction of Gazans in need of medical evacuation are being evacuated. This is unacceptable in light of the dire humanitarian catastrophe which has unfolded over three months.
 
Indeed, WHO’s movements, particularly in northern Gaza and increasingly in the south, have been severely impeded by the ongoing violence inside Gaza. Our operations are further impeded when essential local partners, like the @PalestineRCS, are themselves needlessly impacted by the strikes.
 
This on top of widespread deaths, suffering and decimation of homes, roads and other infrastructure across this tiny coastal strip of land. If the conditions for a cease-fire in hostilities have not been met by now, I do not know what it will take.

WHO reiterates that health must never be a target during conflicts, and all effort must be taken to protect health facilities, health workers, and patients.

name: abelLP
texto: Please note that after the Ottoman Empire crumbled after WW2 , syria, jordan, lebanon, saudi arabia and Isreal were formed . England gave Egypt its independance. Peace and Respect will help all of us including Arabs living in Gaza.  Palestinian are Arabs and their homeland is Arabia . No Judea/Israel. they are Arabs Judea occupiers from the Umayyad time The name Palestine is derived from the Philistines, a seafaring people from Crete who invaded the coast of present-day Israel around 1200 BCE, shortly after the Israelite conquest. The main Philistine dominions never extended much beyond the coastal strip between Gaza and today’s Tel Aviv, and the Philistines disappeared as a people under the Babylonian conquest in the sixth century BCE. It was the Roman Empire, bent on destroying every vestige of Jewish attachment to their land after two successive Jewish rebellions, that invented the name Palestina eafaring people from Crete who invaded the coast of present-day Israel around 1200 BCE, shortly after the Israelite conquest. The main Philistine dominions never extended much beyond the coastal strip between Gaza and today’s Tel Aviv, and the Philistines disappeared as a people under the Babylonian conquest in  the sixth century BCE. It was the Roman Empire, bent on destroying every vestige of Jewish attachment to their land after two successive Jewish rebellions, that invented the name Palestina. Palestinian’s mother native language is Arabic because they are Arabs from Arabia .

No Judea/Israel. they are Arabs Judea occupiers from the Umayyad time The name Palestine is derived from the Philistines, a seafaring people from Crete who invaded the coast of present-day Israel around 1200 BCE, shortly after the Israelite conquest. The main Philistine dominions never extended much beyond the coastal strip between Gaza and today’s Tel Aviv, and the Philistines disappeared as a people under the Babylonian conquest in the sixth century BCE. It was the Roman Empire, bent on destroying every vestige of Jewish attachment to their land after two successive Jewish rebellions, that invented the name Palestina eafaring people from Crete who invaded the coast of present-day Israel around 1200 BCE, shortly after the Israelite conquest. Twenty four year old Eden Yerushalmi from Tel Aviv is a lively person, who spreads positive energies wherever she is. Her apartment is always packed with people and music.
Eden was a bartender at the Nova Music Festival.
On Saturday, October 7th, Eden called her sister, Shani, and told her that she was in a car with two friends who had been murdered. Shani was on the phone with Eden for three and a half hours, until she was captured by terrorists of Hamas organization.
Eden marked her twenty fourth birthday as a hostage in Gaza. We must ensure that she celebrates with her family and friends, soon. 
Bring her home. Now!

name: abelLP
texto: Please note that after the Ottoman Empire crumbled after WW2 , syria, jordan, lebanon, saudi arabia and Isreal were formed . England gave Egypt its independance. Peace and Respect will help all of us including Arabs living in Gaza.  Palestinian are Arabs and their homeland is Arabia . No Judea/Israel. they are Arabs Judea occupiers from the Umayyad time The name Palestine is derived from the Philistines, a seafaring people from Crete who invaded the coast of present-day Israel around 1200 BCE, shortly after the Israelite conquest. The main Philistine dominions never extended much beyond the coastal strip between Gaza and today’s Tel Aviv, and the Philistines disappeared as a people under the Babylonian conquest in the sixth century BCE. It was the Roman Empire, bent on destroying every vestige of Jewish attachment to their land after two successive Jewish rebellions, that invented the name Palestina eafaring people from Crete who invaded the coast of present-day Israel around 1200 BCE, shortly after the Israelite conquest. The main Philistine dominions never extended much beyond the coastal strip between Gaza and today’s Tel Aviv, and the Philistines disappeared as a people under the Babylonian conquest in  the sixth century BCE. It was the Roman Empire, bent on destroying every vestige of Jewish attachment to their land after two successive Jewish rebellions, that invented the name Palestina. Palestinian’s mother native language is Arabic because they are Arabs from Arabia

name: Avi Posner
texto:
Nobody is deprived of food and water. Supplies are entering Gaza each day. Kids are not shot in the head, and bombing ambulances is allowed if they are used to transfer weapons and non-wounded fighters. See here a quote from the “International Committee of the Red Cross” FAQ page (a link at the end):
“If armed forces are using a hospital or school as a base to launch attacks or store weapons, are those places then a legitimate military target?
The laws of war prohibit direct attacks on civilian objects, like schools. They also prohibit direct attacks against hospitals and medical staff, which are specially protected under IHL. That said, a hospital or school may become a legitimate military target if it contributes to specific military operations of the enemy and if its destruction offers a definite military advantage for the attacking side.
If there is any doubt, they cannot be attacked. Hospitals only lose their protection in certain circumstances - for example if a hospital is being used as a base from which to launch an attack, as a weapons depot, or to hide healthy soldiers/fighters. And there are certain conditions too.
Before a party to a conflict can respond to such acts by attacking, it has to give a warning, with a time limit, and the other party has to have ignored that warning. “

name: Israel Defensa (Ñ) 🇮🇱
texto:
Guerra en #Israel
Resumen a la tarde del 14 de diciembre:
🇮🇱🔥🇵🇸🇱🇧🇸🇾🇮🇷🇾🇪
⭕️ Tema Rehenes:
- Hace unos días, familiares de varios rehenes se comunicaron con la Cruz Roja de Gaza para pedirles que les acercaran a los secuestrados las medicaciones que necesitan.
- La respuesta que la Cruz Roja dio a los familiares israelíes fue que "deberían tambien pensar en los palestinos de Gaza que estan siendo bombardeados".
- Un día después, 1.200 abogados enviaron cartas de demandas a la sede de la Cruz Roja en Ginebra.
- El ambiente es tan tenso, que hoy ha llegado a Israel la Presidenta del Comité Internacional de la Cruz Roja (CICR) Marijana Spoljaric, para intentar conciliar en el conflicto diplomático y legal.
- Treinta senadores de los EEUU enviaron una carta mordaz al Secretario General de la ONU, Antonio Guterres, exigiéndole que abra una investigación independiente sobre la violencia sexual de Hamás durante el ataque del 7 de octubre y que no asigne la tarea a la "Comisión de Investigación de la ONU sobre el Territorio Palestino Ocupado". 
- El Senado acusa a esa comisión de la ONU de estar parcializada en contra de Israel. 
- Los senadores exigieron que el Secretario General Guterres condene a "ONU Mujeres" por no haber respondido inmediatamente a la violencia sexual de Hamas tras el ataque del 7 de octubre. 
- Senado: "La demora de la ONU en denunciar la violencia sexual y las violaciones de Hamás son un fracaso moral".
⭕️ Frente de Gaza:
- El Ministro de Defensa israelí, Yoav Gallant, comunicó hoy al Asesor de Seguridad Nacional de la Casa Blanca, Jake Sullivan, que se encuentra en Israel, que se necesitarán varios meses para derrotar a Hamás en la Franja de Gaza. 
- Gallant: Durante más de una década Hamás ha estado construyendo su infraestructura "bajo tierra y sobre la tierra" y para destruir al grupo islamista "se necesitará un largo período de tiempo; durará más de varios meses, pero ganaremos y los destruiremos."
- Las empresas de telecomunicaciones palestinas Paltel y Jawwal informan que nuevamente se han quedado sin servicio de internet a causa de "la agresión israelí".
- Setenta terroristas que resistían desde el Hospital Kamal Adwan, entregaron sus armas y se rindieron. Los prisioneros han sido transferidos a la Unidad 504 del Directorado de Inteligencia y al Shin Bet (Shabak) para ser interrogados.
- Por razones de seguridad, los prisioneros de Hamas atendidos en el Hospital Beilinson de Israel, serán trasladados a una instalación militar.
⭕️ Frente Norte, Líbano:
- La fuerza aérea israelí ha lanzado hoy intensas olas de bombardeos sobre blancos de Hezbollah en el sur del Líbano tanto con la aviación como con UAVs (drones).
- Hezbollah continúa con los lanzamientos de cohetes y misiles antitanque, tanto contra comunidades civiles, como contra puestos militares israelíes.
⭕️ Frente del Yemen:
- Un buque granelero de propiedad búlgara y con bandera de Malta fue hoy abordado cerca de la costa del Yemen. Aun no han informado el nombre del barco.
- Se sospecha una conexión entre el abordaje del granerelo y la presencia de un "pesquero" iraní que estaba en la zona y que apagó su transponder AIS  (comunicador) pocas horas antes del pedido de auxilio del barco atacado. 
⭕️ Frente Internacional:
- El Mossad transmitió a los servicios de seguridad de Alemania la identidad de varios terroristas que planeaban atentar contra blancos israelíes y judíos en ese país.
- Los servicios de seguridad alemanes arrestaron a tres personas y los holandeses arrestaron a una cuarta.
- Vándalos ucranianos atacaron hoy la Menorá (Candelabro) judío de la Ciudad de Kremenchuk (imagen abajo), siendo hoy el día en que se enciende la octava luz de nuestra festividad de Janucá.

Am Israel Jai 🇮🇱

texto_tweet_citado:
Guerra en #Israel
🇮🇱🔥🇵🇸🇱🇧🇸🇾🇮🇷🇾🇪
⭕️ Dada la cantidad de rumores que leo en la cuenta, hago aquí un resumen de las relaciones actuales entre la Casa Blanca y el Gobierno de Israel:
- Los cruces de declaraciones entre Biden y Netanyahu continúan siendo portada.
- La Administración Biden entiende que en la post-guerra se debe contemplar la posibilidad de que la ANP (Autoridad Nacional Palestina) que gobierna parte de los territorios palestinos de Cisjordania desde la Ciudad de Ramallah, se vaya haciendo gradualmente con el control también de Gaza.
- Biden insiste en que la ANP debe ser reforzada en su autoridad civil y fundamentalmente en su imagen, de forma de ganarse apoyo popular tanto en Cisjordania como en Gaza.
- Netanyahu, que gobierna con una coalición muy inestable formada por varios partidos politicos muchas veces antagónicos en el tema palestino, y en la cual hay dos ministros radicales bastante intransigentes, sabe que cualquier acercamiento que tenga con la ANP provocará que el ala derecha de la coalición se salga de la misma y provoque la caída del gobierno.
- Biden insiste que la solución pasa por formar una nueva coalición de gobierno en Israel (sin los radicales), que muestre posiciones mas flexibles con el manejo de Gaza en el "día después de Hamas".
- Netanyahu responde: "Después del gran sacrificio de nuestros civiles y nuestros soldados, no permitiré la entrada a Gaza de quienes educan para el terrorismo, apoyan el terrorismo y financian el terrorismo" (refiriéndose a Fatah, el partido gobernante en Cisjordania).
- De cualquier forma los EEUU han garantizado a Israel que continuarán apoyándola tanto en lo político como en lo militar hasta el final del camino, que no es otro sino la destrucción funcional de Hamas.
- Biden: "Nadie, nadie, nadie en la Tierra verde de Dios puede justificar lo que hizo Hamás. Son brutales, desagradables e inhumanos, y hay que eliminarlos".
- Biden: "Como dije después del ataque, está literalmente en juego la seguridad del Pueblo Judío y la seguridad literal de Israel como estado judío independiente. Pero nuestro compromiso con Israel es inquebrantable".
- Biden: "No hay dudas sobre la necesidad de enfrentar a Hamás. No hay duda sobre eso. Ninguna. Cero. (Los israelíes) tienen todo el derecho a hacerlo".
- Biden: "Ellos (en referencia a Hamas) son ​​animales. Son animales. Han superado todo lo que cualquier otro grupo terrorista haya hecho... desde que se recuerda".

No es secreto que hay importantes desacuerdos con la Administración Biden, y muchos de ellos parecen muy difíciles de resolver pues hay diferencias de enfoque muy amplias, pero las relaciones son tan estrechas, que finalmente se lograrán los entendimientos necesarios. Tengo fe en ello.

Prevaleceremos  🇮🇱

US empire managers always act like telling Israel to end this mass atrocity would be an intercession on Israel's sovereignty, as though THAT would be the US intervening in foreign affairs. In reality the US doesn't need to intervene in Israeli affairs to stop the bloodshed, all it has to do is STOP intervening by backing the slaughter. Israelis are completely open about the fact that this onslaught would be impossible without US weapons and other support; the US could at any time simply stop intervening by backing Israeli crimes against humanity and Israel would be forced to stop.

They reverse reality by misrepresenting non-interventionism as interventionism and the end of an intervention as an intervention, in the same way they reverse the role of victim and victimizer, aggressor and defender, genocide perpetrators and genocide targets, etc. This lets them wash their hands of the atrocities by pretending they're just respecting Israel's sovereignty, when in reality they're just as responsible for the atrocities as Israel.

It's like holding someone down and punching them in the face and telling onlookers "I'm sorry, I can't intervene in the sovereign affairs of my fist." There's no need for the US to intervene between Israel and Gaza; all it needs to do is STOP intervening.

texto:
Guerra en #Israel
🇮🇱🔥🇵🇸🇱🇧🇸🇾🇮🇷🇾🇪
⭕️ Dada la cantidad de rumores que leo en la cuenta, hago aquí un resumen de las relaciones actuales entre la Casa Blanca y el Gobierno de Israel:
- Los cruces de declaraciones entre Biden y Netanyahu continúan siendo portada.
- La Administración Biden entiende que en la post-guerra se debe contemplar la posibilidad de que la ANP (Autoridad Nacional Palestina) que gobierna parte de los territorios palestinos de Cisjordania desde la Ciudad de Ramallah, se vaya haciendo gradualmente con el control también de Gaza.
- Biden insiste en que la ANP debe ser reforzada en su autoridad civil y fundamentalmente en su imagen, de forma de ganarse apoyo popular tanto en Cisjordania como en Gaza.
- Netanyahu, que gobierna con una coalición muy inestable formada por varios partidos politicos muchas veces antagónicos en el tema palestino, y en la cual hay dos ministros radicales bastante intransigentes, sabe que cualquier acercamiento que tenga con la ANP provocará que el ala derecha de la coalición se salga de la misma y provoque la caída del gobierno.
- Biden insiste que la solución pasa por formar una nueva coalición de gobierno en Israel (sin los radicales), que muestre posiciones mas flexibles con el manejo de Gaza en el "día después de Hamas".
- Netanyahu responde: "Después del gran sacrificio de nuestros civiles y nuestros soldados, no permitiré la entrada a Gaza de quienes educan para el terrorismo, apoyan el terrorismo y financian el terrorismo" (refiriéndose a Fatah, el partido gobernante en Cisjordania).
- De cualquier forma los EEUU han garantizado a Israel que continuarán apoyándola tanto en lo político como en lo militar hasta el final del camino, que no es otro sino la destrucción funcional de Hamas.
- Biden: "Nadie, nadie, nadie en la Tierra verde de Dios puede justificar lo que hizo Hamás. Son brutales, desagradables e inhumanos, y hay que eliminarlos".
- Biden: "Como dije después del ataque, está literalmente en juego la seguridad del Pueblo Judío y la seguridad literal de Israel como estado judío independiente. Pero nuestro compromiso con Israel es inquebrantable".
- Biden: "No hay dudas sobre la necesidad de enfrentar a Hamás. No hay duda sobre eso. Ninguna. Cero. (Los israelíes) tienen todo el derecho a hacerlo".
- Biden: "Ellos (en referencia a Hamas) son ​​animales. Son animales. Han superado todo lo que cualquier otro grupo terrorista haya hecho... desde que se recuerda".

No es secreto que hay importantes desacuerdos con la Administración Biden, y muchos de ellos parecen muy difíciles de resolver pues hay diferencias de enfoque muy amplias, pero las relaciones son tan estrechas, que finalmente se lograrán los entendimientos necesarios. Tengo fe en ello.

Prevaleceremos  🇮🇱

ONU, UNICEF, Cruz Roja, todos cómplices por acción y enfatizo, omisión.

Estoy asqueado por la hipocresía de todas esas organizaciones tuertas.

Israel debería retirarse de la ONU, Unicef también en señal de visible protesta. Aun hoy se siguen viendo convoyes de la ONU con armas. O son muy estúpidos o cómplices. No hay término medio.

texto_tweet_citado:
New stats show: In 2022, the Red Cross visited 6,096 prisoners around the world. Palestinians made up around 85% of them.

As of the beginning of Russia's invasion of Ukraine, the Red Cross has visited 1,500 Ukrainian hostages and sent 2,500 messages to families.

And what about the Israeli hostages you asked? The Red Cross did not visit ONE of the hostages in Gaza, much less send a message or provide urgent medical care.
The @ICRC @ICRC_ilot accounts have been bragging about their "neutral intermediary role" in securing the hostages' release, but the truth is that there is nothing to celebrate. Many innocent civilians were put at risk by the Red Cross, and Israeli hostages were treated as second-class citizens.

How come Ukrainian hostages get a different treatment than Israelis? Are their lives not equally important?
